content.description:
Eyed this route and tried out some of the moves. Feels pretty cool - should be worth a go if anyone feels comfortable.

Note the big horizontal rail from

christianmingle.com

probably is off - figure would make the end of the route not super satisfying.
content.location: Start on the north most end of Singles Rock and traverse to the split, climbing up the left side ramp.

content.description:
Good feet and good hands all over this route. Start on the low rail on the southern side of Singles Rock. Make a move onto the rail and stand up for a good rest.

Move your feet up the rail by using an okay left side side pull and then search for a jug just over the top. Use the jug to get above the slab.
content.location: Near the southern most point of Singles Rock.

content.description:
Start on the flake and right crimp in the middle of singles rock. Work up the flake and use a right crimp and one slightly higher.

From there - make a moderate move to a ledge that's pretty good and continue to the top.
content.location: Left most flake on the north side of Singles Rock

content.description:
Short but fun boulder. Feet are good and moves are powerful.

Left hand starts on a big side pull. Right hand can start either on the undercling next to the left hand, or low around the slopey arete.

Move the right hand up to the sharp holds on the arete, then up onto the ledge.

You can then try to throw the left for the edge, or heel hook the starting left hand to move your hand up.

From there, top out using some slopey holds over the top. There's a jug that's kinda far back that if you hit will make it super easy.
content.location: Just left of the big crack in Singles Rock

content.description:
Sit start on the big side pull below the ledge.

Move up to the ledge and then up the side pull above it.

There's a good pocket about 3/4 of the way up on the right side.

Top out is a little scary - just because of how slabby the route is.

Feels a bit like a gym route for the first half - movement is fun.
content.location: Starts just below the ledge just to the right side of the crack in the middle of Singles Rock.
